Fields.DialogueText: From that smile, I'm guessing you've got good news.
Yes, Captain. Repairs to the number 4 engine and propeller shaft are complete.
Excellent, Officer Rahal. The shipyard didn't waste any time, did they?
Start the pre-underway checklist for our departure.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Sounds like the shipyard took care of everything.
Miss Wichita! You overheard the news about the repairs?
Miss Wichita?
Yes, yes I did. Good news, isn't it?
You bet!
Go get started on that checklist, Officer Rahal. The fleet needs us at sea.
Aye aye, Captain.
Are you all right, Wichita? The major repairs are complete, so it follows that you should be feeling pretty good.
Wonderful, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Glad to hear it. I want our Belle in top shape and ready for anything.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were still feeling a bit off.
You have that distant look in your eye, Wichita...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm always ready to throw punches at Morganas!
It's good that you do know better, Captain. Besides, if I didn't know better, I'd say you were worrying too much.
Oh? No disrespect intended, Captain. I just had something on my mind.
We still have some time before we get underway, right?
I'd wager so. Officer Rahal is painfully thorough with those checklists.
Good. I think I'll go out and walk the rails for a bit. Watch the shoreline...
Oh, and make sure the shipyard is cleaning everything up, of course. I'd hate to leave a mess for the next ship that has to come in for repairs here.
Last minute sightseeing, then. I'll see you on the bridge when it's time to cast off our lines.
Some things are hard to fix - especially when we'll be shooting our way out of here any minute now.
@BATTLE
There! See those on the horizon?
Damn, they're closing fast. How did we not see them until now?
The shoreline? We're in no danger of hitting the shore, Captain.
Wrong horizon, Wichita. Quit looking astern, and look out in front of us.
Morgana scum... ruining my sightseeing, as usual. Let's see how they like a fully-armed heavy cruiser busting up their little pack!
@BATTLE
We drove them off, Wichita.
*BOOM*
Wichita, cease fire. All enemy contacts have been defeated.
*BOOM*
Wichita, cease fire!
Oh? Yes, of course.

Fields.MenuText: When I tell you to cease fire, that means stop shooting.
Do we need to go back to the shipyard and get your hearing checked?
You need to pay attention to my orders, Wichita.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I saw a few more out there. My mistake, Captain. I wasn't aware.
Can the shipyard do that? I wasn't aware.
When I start shooting, it can be hard to stop. I'll try to pay better attention, Captain.
We'll talk about this later. For now, let's get to the debrief.
My after-action report will be ready for your review, Captain.
Ughhh...
I thought I might find you here. Officer Coltrain says that you've been watching seagulls for over an hour.
Officer Coltrain is mistaken.
But here you are.
I was only watching seagulls for half an hour. Then I was looking at clouds, and waiting for Ellis to come back in his scout plane.
Ellis? His reconnaissance flight isn't scheduled to return yet.
And that's why I'm still here waiting. I like to watch him return to the ship.
Sometimes he does an extra loop de loop before he lands, and I like to imagine what that would feel like if I were flying the plane.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose it's fine, as long as your other duties are caught up.
Imagine if planes had Belles, too!
If something isn't right, you can talk to me about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh...
Yes! That would be incredible!
Shipyards can't fix everything, Captain.
Gunnery practice starts in just a few minutes. I should probably get down to the weather decks and get ready.
Put that keen eyesight to work, Wichita. Turn our gunners into sharpshooters, right?
Right.
*ALARM*
Oh! Morganas. I can sense them moving in from our starboard beam.
So much for gunnery practice.
Practice just became a final exam. No substitute for the real thing!
I like the enthusiasm. Let's throw some good punches, Wichita.
@BATTLE
Why is everybody standing around the Mark 55 gun like this? Is something wrong with it?
Attention on deck!
At ease, Officer Coltrain. Can somebody tell me what's going on here?
I'll be right out, Captain!
Wichita?
She climbed inside...
She climbed inside the gun barrel? It's an eight inch gun, Officer Coltrain. Even Miss Wichita couldn't fit in there.
Well, more like she... she... phased inside of it. Like a...
Like a what? Like a ghost?
Captain, Miss Wichita doesn't like-
... being called a ghost.
What can I do for you, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I saw everybody standing about and wanted to know what it was all about. That's all.
So... is the gun barrel clean? It must be handy to check a gun from the inside like that.
Are you trying to get yourself shot out of a cannon again?

Fields.DialogueText: A simple inspection, Captain, and  a demonstration of what a Belle can do.
My inspection is complete. This gun is in perfect working order, Captain.
I promise you that I remember your strict orders against such a thing. I wouldn't disobey you, Captain.
Back to work, everybody.
Aye aye, Captain.
Wichita, I'd like to...
*ALARM*
First things first, Captain. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
The chapel was breathtaking. I'll never forget what it was like to walk inside.
The chapel? The beaches were the best part of the shore leave, if you ask me.
I'll bet the people on the beach were your favorite.
Um...
Ha! She's got you there! If I hadn't smacked you on the head, you would've been caught staring at the one with the sunglasses and that red lipstick.
It's not like I could go up and talk to her. I can't speak a lick of French.
Admiring from a distance. Sometimes that's all we can do...
Exactly, Miss Wichita.
That chapel sounds nice, Officer Rahal. I only saw it from the pier, but it must have been lovely on the inside.
It was. The stonework was so...
Attention on deck!
Hello, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Sharing stories about shore leave?
Good to see everybody relaxing on the mess decks.
This conversation doesn't sound professional to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Your officers know how to enjoy shore leave, Captain.
Spending time together is important. Want to join us, Captain?
Just taking a break and sharing stories about our experiences, Captain.
It's time to get back to work. I need all hands on deck for the rendezvous with the supply ship. She's radioed that she's almost here.
We'll be ready.
On my way, Captain.
*ALARM*
Get to battle stations. If the Morganas are here, that means our supply ship could be in danger, too.
We'll make sure the Morganas don't lay a finger on her, Captain!
@BATTLE
We kept our promise, Captain. The supply ship survived the Morgana attack.
A supply ship full of fuel and goods, crawling along at ten knots... Too tempting for the Morganas to lay off, even with a heavy cruiser like us nearby.
Greedy little monsters.
But I'm parched... How long until we can start transferring some of that fuel to us?
Officer Coltrain's last report said safety checks were complete. Refueling should be ready to commence in just a few minutes.
Glad to hear that!
You seem to be...

Fields.MenuText: ... doing better.
... pleased with yourself.
... hiding something.

Fields.DialogueText: Doing better? Was I doing bad before?
It feels good to know that we protected somebody. That supply ship can't defend herself the way that we can, Captain.
A Belle would be in the wrong to do something like that, Captain.
Don't exhaust yourself, Wichita. You're quick to shoulder a heavy load, but I don't want you to end up in the shipyard again.
Cuts and scrapes build character, don't you think? Besides, it takes a lot to poke a hole in all of my armor.
Let's keep it that way. When we drove the Morganas away, I had a feeling they were itching for a chance to attack again.
*ALARM*
You've put a curse on us with words like that, Captain! I'm off to battle stations.
Again.
@BATTLE
Hmmm.
Nothing on radar, Captain. The supply ship is safely away.
Anything from our reconnaissance flights?
Nothing but static on the radio. I think the Morganas have decided to give us a break.
In that case, I'll go check on Wichita. Her guns were chattering away non-stop during that last fight.
Wichita? Are you up here?
In your favorite spot, I see.
Sitting on top of the superstructure is the highest I can get without climbing to the yardarm. I expressly recall...
... that I asked you not to go up there.

Fields.MenuText: You can't hear me calling for you if you go up that high.
You'd only encourage the crew to follow you up there.
The yardarm is not a diving board!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't stray too far from home. Sigh. The story of my life.
Would they really?
"The yardarm is not a diving board!" Yes, yes. I remember.
Looking for Ellis again?
Looking at a lot of things, actually. The clouds are making wonderful shapes today.
Can you read any signs in the clouds? Getting any messages from the heavens?
I am not a witch! Honestly, I thought those rumors were behind us, Captain.
I was just kidding!
*ALARM*
Now look at what you've done! Your superstitions basically begged the Morganas to pester us again...
@BATTLE
The crew looks up to you, Wichita. They'd follow you anywhere.
Wichita? Are you in there? Are you decent?
Wichita?
With respect, Captain, I wouldn't go in there if I were you.
Oh? Why is that?
I don't mean to tell my captain where to go and where not to go, but Miss Wichita...

Fields.MenuText: Is she all right?
Are you all right?
You're damn right you don't tell me where to go.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure. I think she is, but then I heard something through her door.
I'm... I'm fine, Captain. Thanks for asking, but I'm fine.
Miss Wichita is talking to somebody in there.
Who?
That's just it, Captain. She's alone.
Nobody else went in or out, so either she's talking to herself or she's...
Or she's what?
Or she's casting a spell.
Enough of the witchcraft rumors, Officer Coltrain. Things like that won't do anybody any good on this ship.
Aye aye, Captain. Please forget that I even said that out loud.
Don't look so shaken. Head up to the bridge and relieve Officer Rahal. Business as usual, right? I'll take care of things here.
Yes, Captain.
Wichita?
Are you...
I sense a presence. Something wicked approaches us...
Wichita?!
*ALARM*
That was spooky...
@BATTLE
Listening outside of my cabin door? Really, Captain?
Don't try to make this into something it isn't, Wichita. There's no scandal here.
You should have just knocked. Besides, I don't lock my door.
But I did knock!
Try knocking a little more loudly next time. I've got sharp eyes, but my ears can only do so much with all of the ventilation and ship noise.
You really don't lock your door?
No. I close the door for privacy, but I don't need to lock it. I have nothing to hide from the crew.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you afraid somebody will steal your popcorn machine?
I'm still not convinced that you aren't hiding something from me.
Good. If you slept through an alarm, it would be easier for a messenger to wake you up and get you to battle stations.

Fields.DialogueText: I always share my popcorn with the crew. That way, nobody would ever need to steal it.
Privacy isn't the same as keeping secrets, Captain.
Exactly.
All of this aside, we still need to talk about something before we approach the Scapa Flow.
What is that, Captain? As your Belle, I am at your disposal.
Not long ago, one of the officers said that...
Said that...
Said what, Captain?
Sorry, but the smells from that popcorn machine are really distracting!
Smells great, doesn't it? It helps cover up all of the diesel and sweaty sailor smells.
Let me propose something, Captain. We wait until the machine is done popping, then we  share a little bit of popcorn and talk.
All right.
*BANG*
Is something wrong with my popcorn machine?
That's not the popcorn machine—that's gunfire, Wichita!
Oh! Let's get going!
@BATTLE
Can you still see Ellis, even with all of this fog? Impressive.
My eyes are as keen as an eagle's, but I'll admit that I keep losing sight of his plane.
It doesn't stop you from trying, though, does it?
Ha! Never. I love watching airplanes. Flying is so...

Fields.MenuText: Graceful?
Free?
Dangerous?

Fields.DialogueText: It's more than graceful. It's divine.
To soar among the clouds... What I wouldn't give to do that!
It wouldn't be dangerous for me.
But half of the crew probably thinks I can fly around on a broom, right? Haha!
No. They're cured of all that rumor, last time I checked.
Then maybe I used a witch's hex to fool them... *cackle*
Yeah, right. You're just kidding when you say things like that. I'm learning to read that smile on your face, Wichita.
Maybe you are figuring me out. Congratulations! A Belle could do worse than a captain like you.
Is that Ellis?
Hard to see through the haze. Point him out for me.
Right there. See?
I think so...
Why is he tilting his plane side to side like that? Is he trying to get our attention by waggling his wings?
Maybe his radio is out, and he's trying to warn us about something he saw...
Let's get to battle stations just in case.
Right.
@BATTLE
Good thinking on going to battle stations when we saw Ellis flying back to us. He was wiggling his wings to warn us, because his radio had stopped working.
I wouldn't have spotted him without your help, Wichita.
Thank you, Captain.
Ellis should get credit, too. It was a clever bit of thinking to shake his wings like that, warning us as early as possible.
He is amazing, isn't he? Pilots are a special breed.

Fields.MenuText: They have to stay calm under pressure, that's for sure.
It takes guts to trust your life to a flimsy machine like that.
I think ship drivers are just as impressive.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, but the rewards! Sigh. I bet he gets to see marvelous views when he flies up there.
Flimsy? Compared to a heavy cruiser, I suppose. Still, the sea is dangerous, too.
No need to compete, Captain!
I do respect everybody who puts themselves in harm's way for a greater good. Convictions are nothing without the courage to express them.
Spoken like a true warrior of the waves.
Hahaha! You really think so?
I do.
Thanks, Captain!
Now let's get to those damage reports from the last scrape. I want you in top condition.
Quit fussing! I can take a hit.
*ALARM*
Let's hope you can...
@BATTLE
Seen Wichita lately?
Before I left the wardroom I saw her talking to Ellis.
Again?
Not my place to draw conclusions, Captain, but she does talk to him a lot lately.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing wrong with that. Wichita is professional.
Nothing wrong with that. Wichita is always good about talking to everybody on the crew.
Really... I wonder why that is...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! I didn't mean to imply that she wasn't, Captain. It was just something I noticed.
She is, Captain. In fact, I remember how we all used to wonder why she was so strange until we got to know her better.
Captain?
Nothing to worry about, Officer Rahal. Thanks for letting me know.
I'm about to go get some sleep before my next watch. Excuse me, Captain.
Of course.
She must have her reasons.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Not a single one.
Not a single what?
Not a single souvenir, Captain.
You mean from Scotland?
That's right. A shame we weren't able to pull into port and send the crew on some shore leave.
Which means none of them were able to shop for souvenirs for you.
I can only go about ten meters from the ship, so I have to ask them to shop for me. This time, however...

Fields.MenuText: We couldn't stop to make a port call. HQ's orders.
You really love your souvenirs, don't you?
The ten meter limit still bothers you a lot, doesn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: The crew deserved it, but I know it isn't always practical.
I do. It's the next best thing to sightseeing for myself.
I don't want to talk about that right now. It depresses me.
Is that why you talk to Ellis so much?
Exactly, Captain! I may not get any trinkets from a port call, but at least he could tell me about the mountains and the islands and everything else.
He could probably see the shipwrecks while he was flying his reconnaissance missions.
Did you know that during the first World War, ships were deliberately sunk around Scapa Flow to hinder intrusion by German submarines?
The blockships? Yes, but I heard some of those defenses had fallen behind on their maintenance.
Let's hope so. That might keep the Morganas out, too.
Maybe we can drive close to those wrecks next time, Captain. I could probably get close enough to see them if we did.
I'll have to think about it. I don't want us to become one of the wrecks.
Sigh...
@BATTLE
Wichita?
You are the prettiest, aren't you?
What?
The prettiest little seashell of all... Your colors are like a little magical rainbow...
Wichita? Can I speak to you, please?
Sorry, I was...busy.

Fields.MenuText: Busy talking to yourself?
Busy talking to your precious souvenirs?
Relax, I didn't... overhear anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly.
How long were you listening at the door?; Just a few seconds, Wichita. I kept knocking until you answered.
An answer like that means you heard something.
I was just enjoying my souvenirs. Sometimes I talk to them a little bit, and so I didn't hear you come in.
Your souvenirs from all of our port visits... they're really special to you, aren't they?
I can't go ashore, so sometimes this is all I can do to experience the places we visit.
I understand.
Do you really?
I think I can try. It makes sense.
Can you give me a minute, Captain? I know you came here to talk to me about something, but I might need a little more time alone.
Sure. Meet me at the bridge in a few minutes?
I will, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Are these photographs really so important? None of them show any Morgana concentrations.
I didn't mean to hoard them. I was just admiring the views from the reconnaissance plane.
Ellis did a nice job, didn't he?
He did, Captain.
I was about to take these photos to the operations officer to update our intel plots.

Fields.MenuText: Hand them over, Wichita. Those are critical to our reconnaissance mission.
Maybe Wichita can keep one or two of the photos.
You have an unhealthy attachment to your souvenirs.

Fields.DialogueText: If I must...
That's quite thoughtful of you, Captain, but I know these are important.
Until I can fly in a plane for myself, this is the only way I can see sights like this.
Take all of the photos, Officer Coltrain.
Maybe we can get some unofficial photos from Ellis next time he flies.
I would appreciate that very much.
I know these things are important to you, Wichita. You can't go more than ten meters from the ship, and it must be difficult.
Your understanding is...
Are you all right?
It's comforting to me, but... *sniffle*
Let's talk about this later, Wichita.
Oh... yes, perhaps I need to, um, go inspect something by myself for a little while.
I'll be in my cabin whenever you want to talk some more.
I won't be long, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Steady on course zero nine zero, Captain. We'll arrive at the Strait of Gibraltar soon.
The entry to the Mediterranean Sea... Just imagine all of the places we'll be able to visit!
You should hear the crew talk about it, Miss Wichita. They're all excited.
So am I. Captain, could we see Venice?
Or maybe Alexandria?
Alexandria! Captain, I'll submit the request to HQ immediately if you say the word!

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead and draft the port visit requests, but remember they're only that - requests.
I might have some pull with the foreign liaison. I'll see what I can arrange for us.
You do realize that this is a warship with a job to do, right?

Fields.DialogueText: No promises. Understood, Captain.
Would it help if I held my breath until then? Don't fault me if I try!
For now, focus on our patrol. Gibraltar is a narrow strait, and I'd rather we avoid smashing into the rocks.
Alexandria...
Alexandria...
Do you think I'll be able to see Pompey's Pillar from our anchorage?
Good question, Miss Wichita. I couldn't say without reviewing the charts first.
Did either of you hear what I just said?
Alexandria...
Wichita?
*ALARM*
Captain? Sorry, but if you were saying something it will have to wait. We've got Morganas on the horizon!
Sigh...
@BATTLE
Steady as she goes, Officer Coltrain.
Aye aye, Captain. We're pointed at the center of the Strait of Gibraltar.
Excellent. Keep us on this course, and we'll be through safely in no time. A sharp eye for enemy contacts while we make our transit, Wichita.
Wichita?
Look at him go! Do you see Ellis up there, Captain?
Ellis? Our pilot?
He took one of the reconnaissance planes up for a flight to watch our transit through the strait, and he's making a pass over the Rock of Gibraltar.
It's glorious, Captain.
Actually...

Fields.MenuText: ... I was concentrating on getting us through a dangerous, narrow strait. My attention is on the water.
... I stole a peek at the Rock of Gibraltar on the horizon just a minute ago. Breathtaking, isn't it?
Go make some popcorn if you're going sightseeing, Wichita. The rest of us have work to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I'll take in the sights for both of us, Captain.
Staggering, Captain. I hope Ellis got a few pictures for me.
Ouch! We're all performing our duties, Captain. I was just trying to share something nice.
What an amazing view! If only I could climb to the top...
If it helps, none of us can climb that rock right now. Eyes on the horizon, please.
Point taken, Captain.
Visual contacts ahead. If they're merchants, they aren't moving out of the way for us.
Those aren't merchants, they're Morganas.
Maybe they'd enjoy some souvenirs, too? Shells, perhaps? I have some 8-inch ones that my guns can deliver in a hurry!
That's the spirit, Wichita!
@BATTLE
I told you before NOT TO DO THAT!
Amazing! A-maaaa-zing!
Wichita, I don't think sitting on top of the yardarm is the best place for our Belle right now!
I'm so high up! It feels like I can almost touch the sides of the strait if I stretch my arms out...
Climb down from there, please.
This sensation! Is this what it feels like for Ellis in his plane? Wheeee!

Fields.MenuText: Don't make me order you to come down.
Wait until the crew imitates your stunt, and somebody falls. The rest of us aren't Belles, you know.
Jump! Jump! Jump!

Fields.DialogueText: Sigh... Coming down...
I wouldn't want somebody else to get hurt...
Ha! I'd barely clear the side if I jumped... It wouldn't injure me, but it wouldn't exactly be a graceful swan dive into the water.
There. Miss Wichita, ship's Belle, back on deck and reporting for duty, Captain.
Don't sulk, Wichita.
Hmph!
I just said not to...
*ALARM*
Damn! Of all the places to get pinched! No way to maneuver out of this fight in the narrows.
@BATTLE
No, you wouldn't.
Coming down, Captain.
Captain? You asked me to stop by. Do you have a minute to talk?
My cabin door is always open to you.
I thought you might like it if I brought some popcorn. Here, this bowl is for you.
My cabin smells better already! Thanks, Wichita.
I wanted to explain myself and what I've been thinking about.
Do you remember when we patrolled the Scapa Flow?
Scotland? Of course. We fought a few skirmishes, but our patrol came up empty for major coordinated Morgana movements.
I had a hard time giving up the recon photos from our scout planes.
Ah, yes. Ellis took some nice shots. I remember that you wanted to keep them for yourself.
Those photos were lovely, but they also reminded me of something painful.
I've only ever been able to leave the ship once. Outside of the ten-meter radius, I mean.
New Orleans.
That's right.

Fields.MenuText: It left you with a yearning for more experiences like that.
That little expedition was only possible when you were badly weakened.
You wanted me to shoot you out of a cannon!

Fields.DialogueText: Precisely!
But it was worth it.
I wasn't serious! Well, not completely serious...
Oh, what I wouldn't do to run ashore!
That's the part that concerns me a little bit.
How so, Captain?
I want assurances that you won't try anything dangerous. If I hear you convincing the crew to load you into a gun barrel...
You have my word, Captain.
I promise that my guns are for punching holes in Morganas, not for rapid transit.
That'll do. Thanks, Wichita.
Well... that's something I never expected to hear somebody tell me on a ship.
Would the academy have me committed if I told them to put that in the officer training?
*ALARM*
What is it about the Mediterranean that makes the Morganas so aggressive?
@BATTLE
The two of you are standing there with stacks of paperwork. I'm not expecting good news.
Damage reports for your review, Captain.
And what are you here for, Officer Coltrain?
That's just the first half. Officer Rahal needed my help to carry all of the reports.
Why is there so much damage to report that it takes two officers to carry it all?
Are we sinking?!
Damn near, if you ask me...
What was that?
We're in no immediate danger, Captain, but the damage reports are extensive.

Fields.MenuText: These can't be right.
If this is a practical joke, you got me. Now can I see the actual damage report?
If we're so damaged, we might have to come off our mission and find a shipyard.

Fields.DialogueText: We verified every page, Captain.
A practical joke? I assure you, Captain, these reports are not a joke.
Really? I don't think Wichita would like that at all.
This doesn't add up. The ship seems to be performing just fine.
Captain?
My arms... so heavy...
Put those on my desk. Here, I'll clear away some things to make room.
Thanks, Captain.
Ahhhhh...
That will be all. Dismissed.
So many system casualties...how is Wichita holding up like in this condition?
Every...single...page... Oh, my arms are getting tired...
We checked.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
bzzzzzzt...brrrb brzxxzz... Mayday! Mayd...bbzzrrrt...
Officer Coltrain, get on that radio and figure out what's going on.
Aye aye, Captain.
I don't like the sound of it, whatever it is.
Is something the matter, Captain?
I think we've got a-
We've got a merchant convoy in trouble, Captain! They're just over the horizon, and they're under attack by a large Morgana force!
Sounds serious. We may not be in shape to-
Full speed ahead! My armor is thick, and I'd like to see those Morgana wrecks just try and get a piece of me!

Fields.MenuText: Have you seen our damage reports, Miss Wichita? We need to consider our condition.
We don't have much choice, do we?
You seem eager to rush in.

Fields.DialogueText: Damaged or not, I'm still more than a match for them.
Absolutely not, Captain! Let's go!
No time to waste, Captain! I'm itching to fire my guns!
Besides, how long will the civilians on those merchants survive without us?
Full speed ahead.
Ooof!
Wichita?
Nothing... I'm fine...
Full speed ahead, Captain!
@BATTLE
I had a suspicion I'd find you back here in the engine room.
Captain! I was just...
Patching up the number 2 electrical generator?
That's right. I found a minor issue with the main breaker, and I wanted to make sure we didn't lose power.
That repair that you're doing... it's not a permanent fix.
In fact, it's hardly good enough to be called a temporary fix.
Doing the best I can, Captain.
Are you?

Fields.MenuText: A few wraps of electrical tape isn't going to fix the problem for long.
You must be in pain from all of this damage.
Why aren't the electricians helping you with all of this?

Fields.DialogueText: Good enough in a pinch, Captain. We'll be fine.
I can manage, Captain.
They needed a rest, so I figured I would take care of this.
If I didn't know any better, I'd think that-
Ugh, it's a long run to the bridge from all the way back here.
Start running, Captain! I'll meet you up there!
She went right through the bulkhead! Must be nice to be a Belle and have powers like that...
I hope she can handle the fight until I get there.
I'm not convinced, Wichita.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
It's about time, Captain!
You're sweating all over the bridge! Are you all right?
And you question my durability?
What?

Fields.MenuText: Forget what she said. Just concentrate on those Morganas.
Open fire on those Morganas!
Remember those damage reports?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! We're going in at full speed!
Firing at will, Captain!
No time for that, Officer Rahal! Captain, let's start shooting!
@BATTLE
Captain, I...
You look worse than I did when I ran here from the engine room. Go get some rest.
All right...
Officer Rahal.
Yes, Captain?
Help Miss Wichita get to her quarters. She might need it.
Aye aye, Captain.
I don't need...
Just do it. That's an order, Wichita.
Aye aye, Captain.
Wait, are you saying that-?
Go ahead. Barge right in, Captain. I suppose not everybody gets the courtesy of a knock on her door.
I did knock. You answered, remember?
Did I? Maybe I'm really out of sorts. I have a headache like you wouldn't believe...
I mean, no! I'm fine, actually. Uh...
Yes! I probably did say to come in! Ignore what I said before, Captain!
Look, I figured it out, so you don't need to pretend.
Damn...
When Officer Rahal and Officer Coltrain brought me two huge stacks of new damage reports, I didn't believe it at first.
Two stacks? That sounds excessive. Those two need to learn how to-
I said save it, Wichita. I told you, there's no need to pretend.
You've been concealing just how much damage you've actually sustained.
I didn't want to worry you.
You finally figured it out when you saw me taping up the electrical breakers in the engine room, didn't you?
That's right. I remembered that it was only when you were damaged and weakened that you could travel beyond the ten meter radius and leave the ship.
You've been allowing yourself to become gradually more damaged with each battle, without people knowing just how badly you're hurting.
If you get weak enough, maybe you can go ashore again before somebody repairs you.
I didn't want to worry you, and I could handle myself. We won every fight since we entered the Mediterranean, haven't we?

Fields.MenuText: This is serious, Wichita. You put all of us at risk by accumulating damage.
I sympathize. You just wanted to go ashore like everybody else.
If you were anybody else on board, you'd be court martialed for this.

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't have let it go that far. At least, not intentionally.
I'm... I'm glad you can understand why I did it.
But you're not going to?
But what I did was wrong. I'll just have to...
Have to find some other way. Just not this way.
I'm really embarrassed right now. Can you give me a minute?
All right. I'll be on the bridge while you rest. You never know how long we'll have until the next fight.
Aye aye, Captain.
No.
Thank you, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Majestic, isn't it? You can see Pompey's Pillar from here!
I thought you might like the view.
Thanks for arranging this little diversion from our patrol. I'm not sure I've ever sailed this far east in the Mediterranean before.
HQ was happy to grant the request. Your combat record impressed a lot of the top brass, Miss Wichita.
Our combat record, you mean.
You provide the view, and I provide the popcorn. Here you go, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Thanks, and it's still hot!
I don't really like popcorn.
You really do have a popcorn maker hidden in your cabin?

Fields.DialogueText: Everything is hot around here... but yes, I just popped this batch for us to enjoy.
More for me! Besides, this view of Pompey's Pillar is food for the eyes.
No, I use witchcraft to summon it from another dimension.
This moment is better than any souvenir the crew could have brought back to me from shore leave. I have you to thank for that.
And I'm sorry about running myself ragged just for a chance at shore leave. It was... regrettable.
I learned something about you, Wichita. Even when you're banged up, you're tough as nails. I can't think of any other ship that handles herself so well.
Kind of you to say, Captain.
We learned a lot about each other on this voyage, Captain. From Norfolk to Alexandria, I discovered something about you, too.
You did? Like what?
I found out that you're more to me than my Captain. I consider you a true friend.
Thanks.
By the way, friend, do you think that... Oh, never mind.
What is it?
Well, do you think Ellis would mind if I just sat in his plane for a bit when he's not using it for reconnaissance? I wouldn't fly away or anything.
Promise you won't try?
Promise. Besides, if I wanted to fly I'd just use my broom.
Haha!
Hahahahaaaah!
What?!
Oh, if you could have seen your face, Captain!
One more pack of Morganas wants to try their luck. Let's make them hurt!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
